image.alt: Smiling patients at OZ Orthodontics welcoming you to our practice

Home.title: Quality Orthodontic Care for You and Your Family

paragraphs.text: From ages 2 to 100, no patient is too young or too old to benefit from orthodontic care. Whether you need straighter teeth, help with jaw pain or headaches, improved breathing, or better sleep, our goal is to give you a smile that feels as good as it looks. Dr. James takes a whole‑health approach to orthodontics, so every treatment is designed with your satisfaction and wellness in mind.

We combine modern diagnostics, thoughtful treatment planning, and a warm, family-friendly office to make your visits efficient and comfortable. You’ll find clear explanations, easy scheduling, and treatment options that fit your life.

items.title: Whole‑Health Care
items.text: We address function as well as appearance so treatment can improve breathing, jaw comfort, and long‑term health, not just straightness.

items.title: Board‑Certified Expertise
items.text: Dr. James is a dual specialist in orthodontics and orofacial pain, bringing advanced training to complex cases and airway‑focused care.

items.title: All Ages Welcome
items.text: We treat toddlers through seniors with tailored plans that respect growth, function, and family priorities.

items.title: Patient‑Centered Service
items.text: Friendly staff, short wait times, flexible financing, and clear communication make each visit easy for busy families.

paragraphs.text: Dr. James David Roblee, DDS, MSD, is a board‑certified orthodontist with additional Diplomate certification in Orofacial Pain. He earned his DDS from the Texas A&M College of Dentistry in 2015, completed a two‑year residency in Orofacial Pain and Dental Sleep Medicine at UCLA, and became a Diplomate of the American Board of Orofacial Pain in 2017. Dr. James completed his orthodontics residency at the University of the Pacific, earning his MSD in 2019. His unique dual training lets him treat tooth alignment alongside airway, TMJ, and chronic facial pain issues for more complete, long‑term results.

image.alt: Dr. James Roblee, board-certified orthodontist and Diplomate of the American Board of Orofacial Pain

paragraphs.text: We offer airway‑focused orthodontics, clear aligners, traditional braces, and expansion options to meet each patient’s functional and aesthetic goals.

image.alt: Clear aligners shown in a hand, representing virtually invisible treatment
Patient smiling with traditional braces
Orthodontic appliance representing arch expansion and appliance therapy
Patient enjoying improved breathing and sleep after airway‑focused care

testimonials.author: Jacob A.
testimonials.testimonial: "Dr. James changed my life! He treated my TMJ dysfunction without needing an operation. He’s an incredible orthodontist and an even better guy."

testimonials.author: Bronwen H.
testimonials.testimonial: "Dr. James is an exceptional orthodontist with a deep understanding of both function and aesthetics. Thanks to his thoroughness and skill, my treatment was a success. I began sleeping better within weeks and eventually had the energy to return to school."

testimonials.author: Julia B.
testimonials.testimonial: "Within weeks of my MARPE procedure, breathing at night has completely changed. No more waking up with dry mouth. I feel like my eyes are less puffy and dark underneath. My tongue posture has naturally corrected."

testimonials.author: Erin L.
testimonials.testimonial: "Dr. James and his office are so professional and hands‑on. They made my 6‑year‑old feel right at home, while helping keep my other two littles entertained throughout the whole appointment."

og_meta.title: OZ Orthodontics — Fayetteville, AR
og_meta.description: Airway‑focused orthodontics and family care from Dr. James Roblee. Clear aligners, braces, expansion, and TMJ care.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: At OZ Ortho, we’re committed to serving our patients with the highest quality care and a customer-service mentality. We make patients and their families feel welcome and at ease, with attention to comfort and minimal wait times.

We strive to offer affordable treatment options that fit your life. As one of the only dual specialists in the country board certified in both orthodontics and orofacial pain, Dr. James takes a holistic approach that addresses both function and aesthetics.

Whether you’re looking for straightened teeth, relief from TMJ pain, better sleep, or a combination of those goals, the OZO team supports you every step of the way with modern techniques and clear communication.
Through thoughtful care, advanced technology, and a focus on long-term health, we aim to create confident smiles and healthier outcomes for every patient who walks through our doors.

image.alt: Dr. James Roblee portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. James David Roblee — known as “Dr. James” in the office — is a born and raised Northwest Arkansas native and proud University of Arkansas graduate. He earned his DDS from the Texas A&M College of Dentistry (formerly Baylor College of Dentistry) in 2015, and from there ventured further west to UCLA, where he completed a two‑year residency in Orofacial Pain and Dental Sleep Medicine. He became a Diplomate of the Board of Orofacial Pain in 2017.

Dr. James completed his orthodontics residency at the University of the Pacific in San Francisco earning his MSD in 2019. He is one of few dual specialists in the country trained in both orthodontics and orofacial pain, making him an expert in dentofacial orthopedics, proper airway function, and chronic pain management, including TMJ pain, as well as dental aesthetics.

Passionate about continued education, Dr. James is an active member in several prestigious dental organizations, including the American Academy of Orofacial Pain, the World Dentofacial Sleep Society, and the American Academy of Restorative Dentistry. He has been invited to share his expertise from California to Florida, and enjoys hosting courses right here in Northwest Arkansas alongside his father and brother, also practicing orthodontists.

image.alt: Dr. James Roblee photography work

paragraphs.text: After earning his undergraduate degree at the University of Arkansas, Dr. James earned his DDS from the Texas A&M College of Dentistry in 2015. He completed advanced training in Orofacial Pain and Dental Sleep Medicine at UCLA and later finished his orthodontics residency at the University of the Pacific, where he received his MSD in 2019.

image.alt: Dr. James and family

paragraphs.text: During his time in California, Dr. James learned to drone and became a skilled photographer. He is married to his college sweetheart, Holly, and together they have three sons. When he’s not working, you can usually find Dr. James in the backyard with his boys, tending to plants, or taking an ice bath.

image.alt: Dr. James with his son Connor
Family enjoying time together — start your consultation today

image.alt: Smiling patients in a modern orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: Virtually invisible trays gently move teeth without brackets or wires, so you can eat and brush normally while undergoing treatment tailored to your lifestyle.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Traditional and ceramic braces remain a reliable solution for complex alignment and bite correction, available for children, teens, and adults.
Durable and cost-effective, metal braces use brackets and wires to move teeth gradually and predictably.

image.alt: Dental checkup with metal braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic brackets blend with tooth color for a more discreet look while delivering effective results.

image.alt: Patient smiling with ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: We offer teen-friendly options and support to keep treatment on schedule and comfortable.

image.alt: Two teens smiling with braces
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Expansion uses appliances to widen the upper jaw, creating room for teeth and sometimes improving breathing and bite function.
Expanders guide jaw growth in younger patients; for select older patients we offer advanced options to achieve skeletal changes.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention
Early intervention and expander device in clinic

paragraphs.text: MARPE is a minimally invasive option that can widen the upper jaw in patients who are past typical growth windows; many patients notice improved breathing and reduced mouth dryness afterward.

image.alt: 3D treatment planning and skeletal expansion imagery

paragraphs.text: Dr. James Roblee is board-certified by the American Board of Orofacial Pain. Our team evaluates jaw, facial and head pain with a whole-person approach, often combining conservative therapies and orthodontic care when appropriate.

image.alt: Modern clinic room for orofacial pain consultation

paragraphs.text: We treat TMJ dysfunction using conservative, evidence-informed approaches with the goal of reducing pain and restoring function; many patients improve without the need for surgery.

image.alt: Digital imaging used in TMJ evaluation

paragraphs.text: Airway health is part of our treatment planning; expanders, targeted orthodontics, and coordinated care can help reduce mouth breathing and improve sleep quality for many patients.

image.alt: 3D airway and sleep-focused treatment planning

paragraphs.text: Custom retainers help protect your investment. We offer removable and fixed options with clear guidance to keep your smile stable for years.

image.alt: Patient holding a custom orthodontic retainer
Family enjoying time together — start your consultation today
